name: duplicati
description: Store securely encrypted backups in the cloud!
readme_summary: Duplicati is a free, open-source backup client written in C# that securely stores encrypted, incremental, and compressed backups on cloud storage services and remote file servers. It supports various destinations like Amazon S3, Google Drive, and WebDAV, and offers features like AES-256 encryption, a built-in scheduler, and flexible backup options.
key_features: Support for multiple cloud storage services (Amazon S3, Google Drive, WebDAV, etc.)
VSS/LVM support for backing up open files
primary_use_case: Securely backing up data to cloud storage services.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a diligent librarian carefully archiving precious books (representing data) into sturdy, locked chests (encrypted backups). The librarian uses a special device that compresses the books and duplicates them, sending the copies via glowing tubes to various cloud-shaped repositories in the sky. A small screen on the librarian's desk displays a progress bar and encryption details. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, warm lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear details and a focus on conveying security and efficiency.

name: lmms
readme_summary: LMMS is a free, open-source, cross-platform digital audio workstation (DAW) software. It provides tools for music production, including composing, arranging, and mixing, with features like a Song Editor, Pattern Editor, Piano Roll, and Mixer, along with support for various plugins and standards.
key_features: Song-Editor for arranging melodies, samples, patterns, and automation
Pattern-Editor for creating beats and patterns
Piano-Roll for editing patterns and melodies
Mixer with unlimited mixer channels and arbitrary number of effects
Many powerful instrument and effect-plugins out of the box
Full user-defined track-based automation and computer-controlled automation sources
Compatible with many standards such as SoundFont2, VST(i), LADSPA, GUS Patches, and full MIDI support
primary_use_case: Music production, including composing, arranging, and mixing audio tracks.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled composer stands in a vibrant recording studio, orchestrating a symphony of sounds. Musical notes flow from various instruments (synthesizers, drum machines, keyboards) and converge on a central mixing console, where the composer meticulously adjusts levels and adds effects. The console's screen displays a simplified LMMS interface. Digital sound waves radiate outwards, creating a harmonious blend. Small code snippets representing audio processing algorithms float subtly in the background. The studio is bathed in warm, creative lighting. The composition is focused and balanced, emphasizing the creative process. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: tinypilot
description: Use your Raspberry Pi as a browser-based KVM.
readme_summary: TinyPilot turns a Raspberry Pi into a browser-based KVM (Keyboard, Video, Mouse) over IP. This allows users to remotely control and access a computer through a web browser, offering features like video capture, keyboard/mouse forwarding, and clipboard integration.
primary_use_case: Remote KVM access to computers via a web browser using a Raspberry Pi.
cover_image_prompt: A ship captain at the helm of a vessel, steering with a Raspberry Pi connected to the ship's controls. The ship's navigation screen displays a remote desktop interface. The captain confidently navigates through stormy seas, representing remote access overcoming challenges. Small UI elements overlay the navigation screen, showing keyboard and mouse inputs. The ship's name, 'TinyPilot,' is subtly displayed on its hull. The scene is set at twilight with dramatic lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: memory_graph
description: Teaching tool and debugging aid in context of references, mutable data types, and shallow and deep copy.
readme_summary: The `memory_graph` repository is a Python package designed as a teaching tool and debugging aid. It helps users understand concepts like references, mutable data types, and shallow/deep copying by visualizing data structures and program state, including the call stack.
key_features: Provides a web debugger for live demos
Can render graphs to different output formats (PDF, SVG, PNG, DOT)
primary_use_case: Teaching and debugging Python code related to data structures, references, and mutability.
cover_image_prompt: A cartographer meticulously charting a complex network of interconnected islands, each island representing a data structure in Python. The cartographer uses a special lens that reveals the hidden connections and shared references between the islands, highlighting areas of mutability with glowing markers. Small UI elements float above the islands, displaying code snippets and variable names. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop filled with maps and charts. The composition is clean and focused, with a clear visual hierarchy. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.

name: noScribe
description: Cutting edge AI technology for automated audio transcription. A nice GUI for OpenAIs Whisper and pyannote (speaker identification)
readme_summary: noScribe is a free and open-source AI-based software for automated audio transcription, primarily designed for qualitative social research and journalistic use. It leverages Whisper and pyannote for transcription and speaker identification, running locally without sending data to the internet, and includes an editor for reviewing and correcting transcripts.
key_features: Integrated editor for transcript review and correction
Based on Whisper, faster-whisper, and pyannote
primary_use_case: Automated transcription of interviews for qualitative social research or journalistic purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously transcribing spoken words from old wax cylinders into a digital document. The librarian uses advanced AI tools, represented by glowing interfaces subtly overlaid on the desk, to convert the audio. The scene shows the wax cylinder as the input and the digital document as the output. The library is filled with shelves of books, symbolizing knowledge and research. Small UI elements showing audio waveforms and transcription snippets are visible. The scene is set in a warmly lit, classic library with a focused composition. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style with clear outlines and a vintage color scheme.

name: spec-kit
description: ðŸ’« Toolkit to help you get started with Spec-Driven Development
readme_summary: Spec Kit is an open-source toolkit designed to facilitate Spec-Driven Development, which prioritizes specifications as executable entities that generate working implementations. It provides a CLI (`specify`) for initializing projects and checking specifications, aiming to shift the focus from coding to defining product scenarios and predictable outcomes. The toolkit also integrates with AI agents to automate parts of the development process.
key_features: Specify CLI for project initialization and specification checking
Integration with AI agents for automated development tasks
Tools for establishing project principles and development guidelines
primary_use_case: To enable developers to adopt Spec-Driven Development by providing tools and a framework for creating executable specifications that drive software implementation.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect standing before a blueprint-generating machine, transforming abstract specifications into detailed building plans. The machine uses a special lens to interpret the specifications, revealing hidden requirements that glow blue. Successfully generated plans emit a green aura as they are printed. Small screens around the machine show code snippets and data visualizations. The scene has a blue and green color scheme with dramatic lighting. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.
